content:
Trigger a Custom Event from an Action on a FlexCard

Notify a FlexCard of an event occurring from an action on an element. Then execute an action based on the event. Custom Events are used to communicate between a child and its parent, whether it's between a child FlexCard and its parent, or between an element and the FlexCard it's on.

For example, add an action on an embedded child FlexCard that updates a Field element value on the parent FlexCard when clicked.

See Communicate with Events.

From the FlexCard Designer, drag an Action element into a state.
Select Event from the Action Type dropdown.
Select Custom from the Event Type dropdown.
In Event Name, enter the name of the event.
IMPORTANT

Donâ€™t use reserved names: reload, updatedatasource, remove.

See FlexCards Reserved Event and Channel Names.

(Optional) To enable the event to bubble up through the DOM, select Bubbles. When triggering a custom event from a nested element, enable Bubbles.
(Optional) To pass contextual data as a key/value pair, click + Add New next to Input Parameters:
Enter a variable name in the Key field.
Enter the variable value in the Value field.

Configure the event listener that performs an action when the event is fired. See Add an Event Listener to a FlexCard.

Download a Sample Custom Event DataPack
Download a sample Custom Event DataPack to import into your org. Enable an action on a child FlexCard or another element to notify the parent FlexCard of an event occurring. Then execute an action based on the event.
SEE ALSO
Download a Sample Custom Event DataPack
title: Triggering Custom Events in OmniStudio FlexCards
